texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ugh...
The sleeping space inside Hachimaru isn't that big.
I can't even stretch my legs.
I wake up feeling a bit sore.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: *Snore*
I go out to the garage and find Azuki snoring away peacefully.
Her black top and jeans are haphazardly thrown on the back of a chair.
Is she gonna sleep like this every day from now on?
She shouldn't be showing so much to anyone except her boyfriend or whatever.
How can she leave herself so exposed?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mmh...
She turns over and sideways in my direction.
The way her chest is sandwiched between her arms only emphasizes her cleavage.
I clear my throat and head for the washbasin.
Seeing myself with short hair in the mirror surprises me for a second.
I wash my face and do some gargles.
It doesn't look like Azuki's waking up right now.
I take a look at my wristwatch.
Dad should have gone to work by now.
Even though I've only stayed in the garage for 2 nights, it feels like it's been way longer.
It was Saturday when Sumomo showed up and I had a falling out with dad.
Considering I'm going to the academy starting today, I won't have time to relax.
I change clothes, get some more changes from my room, and then scavenge some food out of the kitchen.
The garage has a small fridge, and there's camping equipment, so we can light some fires.
I get cereal, milk, toast, and eggs.
I also grab instant coffee, dry spaghetti, and some bags of rice.
Plus some instant curry, pasta, and cup noodles as well.
All the easy to make stuff goes straight into a plastic bag.
I notice a single set of dirty dishes in the sink.
Imagining my dad eating here alone makes my heart ache.
I wash them and put them to dry.
I hope he notices and understands that I'm not rebelling against him just because.
The idea of leaving him a note saying I'm going to class crosses my mind, but it feels a little too cowardly on my part.
How long do my classes take anyway?
It's been so long that I can't remember.
I should be able to get back home before he does, at least.
If I'm missing anything else, I can come pick it up.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ah, Candy. Where did you go?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This is kind of my garage, so try to wear clothes.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ah, my bad. It's just so hot.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's no excuse...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't be shy! This is just some eye candy for my sweet boy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's annoying...
I put down the plastic bag on the wooden stump table in front of the sofa.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Whazzat?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Food and my clothes.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, for real? What a nice host.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't eat it all.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't you worry, my boy. I'm used to living with people, you know?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And that's why you parade around in your underwear?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh? Where's the bananas?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's none.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why's that? Azuki's breakfast must include at least 50\% bananas.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's news to me... Stop complaining and eat.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey, how old are you again?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uhh, sixteen.
When she hears the answer, she stops on her tracks.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Whoa, you're a baby. You don't remember anything before the wave eating started, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't, yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I see... That so...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, it's whatever. What else did you get? Eggs? We can make fires here?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's a stove and a kettle for camping that we can use.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You can open the shutter and use them in front of the garage during daytime on weekdays, but put it all back in before evening.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm going to class now.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go with the wind, young master.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm gonna get angry if you keep making fun of me!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're angry already!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whatever!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hurry up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll notice if you steal something again, so don't even try.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Copy that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And put on clothes.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Copy that too.
I heave a huge sigh.
And I'm supposed to be the kid when there's adults like that?
I'm already so fatigued that my steps feel heavy.
The academy, huh?
What a hassle.
There's basically no people I know there.
Just one week. Five days. And it's only during the day.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.
I leave home and walk to the academy for the first time in god knows how long.
I look up at the sky to see it covered by a blanket of white birds.
And beyond that, I can see the streak of Halley's Comet.
It's the 11th today.
Just 2 weeks left until the 28th.
Am I really going in the right direction?
At least things changed.
I gotta go with the flow now.
It takes me about 15 minutes to make it to the academy in the end.
It's not that far away.
Apparently Nariyama Sky Academy used to be an international airport before.
But fifteen years ago there was a big accident that involved communications all over the world failing, and it was almost completely destroyed.
Terminal 1 was damaged even more, so it's a no entry zone now. Terminal 2 was in good enough shape that they rebuilt it into a science academy.
The air routes are closed now, and it seems like we can't use something called communication networks anymore.
To be honest, I just didn't grow up with any of that, so I can't imagine how life back then was like.
The only thing I know is that life used to be more convenient before.
I hear that people used to be able to carry mobile phones with them, have cars that drove themselves, and even right shop from home.
Mom and Dad's generation knew all about that.
It reminds me of the plane I photographed a few days ago.
If something that big really was able to fly through the sky before, I sure would like to have a ride at least once.
I would have also liked to photograph one of them while it flies.
Maybe I can go and take pictures in the terminal when classes are over and I leave my stuff back home.
The academy comes into view.
The academy doubles as a research institution and a university. They also have high school and undergraduate courses, so the whole place is huge.
Both researchers and students go to the same place, so the entrance is always packed.
The academy's entrance is wide open.
There's remnants of the airport still.
There are two elevators leading up to the big hall on the fifth floor, and a neat little cafe on the left side.
I often see their ads for part-time jobs around the academy, so I'm sure the place must be manned by students.
The tables and chairs are arranged sparsely across the big space.
Students and people in white lab coats sit around the tables.
The academy is just as I remember it.
Nothing seems to have changed much in all the months I was absent.
I walk up to the elevator, taking in the familiar sights.
I can't even remember where my classroom is supposed to be, but I finally make it after following some directions on the building's map.
I can hear the voices of students behind the door.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
I sigh and reach a hand out to the door.
Then, after taking a few deep breaths, I open it.
All noise in the classroom stops.
All eyes are on me.
I try to not think about it and step in.
The first thing I realize is that I don't know where my seat is supposed to be.
My gaze wanders until I make eye contact with one of the boys seated in the front row.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um, I don't know where my seat is.
Upon hearing that, the boy simply points me to a seat by the back.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Thanks.
I walk to the seat he pointed me to and sit down.
Thankfully, the seat is right by the back window.
And it's nowhere near the teacher's podium.
I look out the window instead of paying attention to the glances.
After a while, the others start talking again and the bustle returns to the classroom.
The academy's bell rings, and the door in the front of the classroom opens.
And from it, Sumomo walks in.
She turns my way as soon as she enters the classroom.
She looks over the classroom, then smiles and waves at me when she sees me sitting in what was probably an empty seat until today.
But then, I hear someone clear their throat in the back of the classroom.
At some point, a middle-aged teacher entered the classroom and sat in the folding chair near the rear door.
Is that her advisor?
After hearing him, she immediately puts her hand down.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Good morning, all. I'll take attendance. Aki...

texts.name: Female Student
texts.text: Present.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Amei.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Present.
Everyone turns to me again.
Sumomo steals a glance at me and smiles before looking back at her attendance book.
She's acting totally different behind that podium than her usual self.
Her voice sounds a lot more subdued, to start with.
And her expression is as stiff as stone.
She was the very image of life back in the garage.
A little disappointed, I just stare at her standing there at the podium.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
As expected, I was swarmed after such a long absence, and was finally let go after 4 p.m.
I was asked about why I didn't come to class, and told I need to have perfect attendance form now on if you wanna graduate in 3 years.
I was also advised to think about what I wanna do in the future seriously, and so on.
They also asked me to come for complementary summer break lessons to make up for the lost time.
I just nodded and said yes to everything, but in the end I was still chewed out for 1 whole hour.
And the person doing all this was the same teacher that was looking over Sumomo this morning.
It seems like he's my homeroom teacher.
As for me..
I'd rather talk with Sumomo over him by a long shot.
No matter what came of it, Sumomo went through the trouble of coming to my house.
That other teacher that preferred to grill me over not coming today must have spent the weekend taking it easy instead.
On second thought, I suppose it's better that the credit for dragging a problem child back to school goes to Sumomo. I bet it'll help her career.
I didn't have any classes with her today.
I wonder if there'll be one lesson with her at least once this week.
At least I got through 1 of the 5 days.
Only 4 left.
I'll just shut up and endure it.
Just let it pass, Kanna.
Summer vacation starts in just four days. I can search for the place Mom was gonna shoot the comet from while we work on Hachimaru.
Hachimaru worked once before.
I'll just look over Azuki as she repairs it, and then look for Mom's location.
My summer plan is in motion now.
But Azuki might very well try to steal Hachimaru while I'm not looking.
If she lied about Hachimaru not being good again, she might be gone with it by the time I get home.
The anxiety that thought causes me turns my swift pace into a jog.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Huff* *Huff*

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, Candy. You're all sweaty. Why so heated?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Huff* *Huff* ... *Sigh*
I find Azuki working under the hood.
I put my things on the sofa and stand next to her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you doing?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Repairing it, of course.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can see that...
I notice black, box-shaped thingie by her feet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: A starter.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I think that's the problem. Neither the relay or the fuse had any issues.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Remember how the thing doesn't get cranking when you turn the ignition anymore?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-Yeah?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The thing that goes all vroom vroom when you turn the key and it tries to turn on.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: When you don't hear that, it means the electrical system is bust. The problem is either the fuse, the relay, or the starter.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And sadly for us, it looks like the starter kicked the bucket this time.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Is that bad?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No choice but to order a new one. If it was a fuse I could get replacements, like those over there.
Azuki points to the back of the garage.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I see...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How long will it take?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hmm... About 2 weeks, I'd say?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's a long while.
I would get barely enough time.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Without a starter, I can't even check up the fuel, air, or ignition systems in the first place.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Though the scan tool isn't giving off any red flags.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This little fella tells me where the failures are when I connect it onto the car.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Since the standard hasn't changed, you can still use it on most stuff. It doesn't give as detailed a report as it does with current models, but it's good enough.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So it'll work if we can get the new starter?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Maybe. The scan tool isn't infallible.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Though if it doesn't work at that point, even I would be a bit stumped.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: On that note, coffee.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, what kind of tool is that?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Screw your head back between your shoulders, boy. I'm taking a break. Brew me some coffee.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, a cup of coffee, right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Sick. Thanks.
I start rummaging through the plastic bag I brought this morning for the instant coffee when I realize something.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why do I have to make YOU coffee?! Do it yourself!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aw, come on! Don't be like that! I'm teaching you stuff, aren't I?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Well, yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The car won't be magically fine forever after I fix it this one time. Cars like this turn to scrap unless you know how to maintain them.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: How does one coffee sound?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I got it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That's my candy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't push your luck.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: How was class?
She says, slurping up the instant coffee I brewed.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Had been a while since you showed up, right? So, is that bitch really a teach?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I didn't have class with her today.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That so? What does the bitchy peach even teach? Agriculture or something?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't think we have that course?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's a good question, actually.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No matter what she teaches, I can barely imagine her doing it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You said we have to order a new starter, right? Is there anything we can do while we wait for it to get here?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Not much, I reckon.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Remember how the car was making a funny sound while we pushed it? Something must have messed up one of the tires.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Guess I'll take a look at that in the meantime. Then there's the bumper. I ordered a new one, but it's not like can't run without it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You don't mind I took the liberty of ordering the parts, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's fine.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Good.
I stare down at the mug in my hands.
The warm coffee glides across the polished bottom as I turn it around.
I see myself and my new haircut reflected in it, and I remember Sumomo's joyous smile when she finished styling my hair.
I wonder why Sumomo sounds so sad at class.
I can't help but wonder as I remember the joy she showed while cutting my hair.
After noticing Azuki bringing her own cup to her lips several times, I finally look back up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Is there anything I can help with?
Azuki eyes Hachimaru.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Not really, until the parts get here. It's just a waiting game now.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, you can always look at me working if you want.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: All right.
After that, Azuki taught me about the tires. Time flies until we notice the sun setting.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Howdy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Bitchy! Wazzup!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Peach!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, it's not like I want you calling me peach either.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you doing here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Came to hang out?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why? I'm going to class. I'll be there tomorrow.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I know that already.
Sumomo pouts and looks at me with puppy eyes.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Just let me hang around with you guys! What's the harm in that?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's not like we're friends or anything.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I brought snacks!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: AND booze!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can't drink.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Now you're talking, Bitchy! Let her in, Candy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's Peach! Actually, can you stop it with that nickname?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Blegh! Another sweet one! The heck is this?! You brought a bunch of sweet crap!
Azuki shouts after downing her third colorful can of alcohol that Sumomo brought.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's sooo yummy! It's like drinking juice.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This is why you're the Bitchy Peach!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Try making sense!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Damn sweet bitch.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahahah! So lame!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I need you to stop calling people lame like that!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!
I noticed Azuki's face getting red right after the first drink.
Sumomo's drinking at the same pace, but she's the same as usual.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Heh... You can call me the Scrap Hunter, Azuki.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Pfft! Ahahahah! Man, that was sooooo lame!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Who's gonna call you that with a straight face?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Sh-Shut your piehole before I clip it shut! You bitch! Four-eyes! Bowl head!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No, I'm not!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You literally are!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is not how I really look, dummy!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The fuck are you talking about? Is the shitty sweet drink getting to your head already? I guess bitches can't hold their drinks!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This bitch can drink you under the table, you know?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Nah, you're dead drunk already. I know these things.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You fell for it! Pretending I'm drunk is my talent!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Obscene!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's not! It's just, kind of like going with the flow!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, it's not it can't get just a little naughty.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You slut!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I only do it with guys I vibe with, not with just anyone! Besides, I used to make tons of money back when that was my gig.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? You mean like selling yourself?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's the only thing I didn't do. I did use to work in night districts, though.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, like a hostess?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, at a cabaret! About when I was 20 years old.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You bet! I used to get guys to spend over 1,5 million yen on a single night!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Take a hike! You're just drunk and talking outta your ass! I know these things!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're the only drunk one here.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not! This is kiddies juice!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Man, I didn't expect you to be such a damn softie! Like, I'm falling in love! I wanna go and hug the crap out of you!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who do you think you're calling softie? ! I'm not a damn Q-car!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Q-car? What's that? You know, Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not at all.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Like the old car toys! You know, the ones that you wind up and let go! They go all vroom vroom! They're damn cute!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Talk about generation gap! Your age's showing!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't you dare! My name's Azuki!
Suddenly, she shouts at me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, what?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You were thinking of calling me grandma, weren't you?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, I swear...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Candy, I always knew. You're a bit cheeky, but you're a good kid.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I always knew.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Granny!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're fucking dead!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Man, you two sure know how to make noise.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Zzz... I'm not drunk... *Snore*

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: She's sleep talking. What a cutie.
Sumomo picks up her bag and gets ready to go home, but stops to look at Azuki for a moment.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Have some mercy next time. I'm the one that has to deal with her.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahah! Sorry about that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Though really, thanks. For hanging around and eating together and all that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh? I didn't really do anything. It was pretty much Azuki talking.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But you're lending us the place.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I guess 1 or 2 more people don't make much difference.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But it made me really happy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Whatever.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: See you tomorrow.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Sure.
Sumomo waves goodbye then leaves.
For some reason, I see her off outside and watch her go for a while.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
I collect the empty cans scattered on the stump table and put them in a plastic bag.
There's still some snacks left, but I just throw them into the bag as well.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Haah... I can hold my booze better!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not... drunk at all!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're not...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm no softie...
She slurs the last part of that sentence and shambles up.
She sits up, and just stares at me.
It's kind of scary.
Her mouth's a little open.
And those thin lips are...
No! This isn't the time for that! I gotta—

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm gonna go to sleep.
But before I can turn away, she grabs my arm and pulls.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Aaah!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We're not done talking yet!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wh-What is it?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I tried drinking canned shochu highball until I got drunk once.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wha?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And I didn't get drunk no matter how much I drank!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uuuh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Right?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Azuki, I—

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Right? Right?
Azuki whispers, as she brings her face close to mine.
I can feel her hot breath on my nose.
And it stinks!
It reeks of alcohol.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: M-Move over!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I won't!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You stink!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Azuki!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: How am I a softie?! You damn bitch!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo left!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Ah, Candy. It's you. What is it? Why so chummy all of a sudden?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-You're the one on top of me!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Guess a healthy boy gets urges, huh? Ain't that right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: K-Knock it off!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You just wanna feel good, don't you?
Azuki says, as she begins drawing circles on my chest with her fingertips, slowly tracing her way down.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: S-Stop it! Ah! Azuki!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heheh...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ngh!
I can't get her off me.
I can feel her warmth all over me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Do you taste like cherries? Maybe milk?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: S-Stop...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ugh...
Azuki's sly smile turns into a tight pout, and I don't like the sound she's making.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ngh...
She's doing that sound again.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Blaaaaaargh!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What the FUCK?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Blegh!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I stink! Dammit!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I barfed.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Time to sleep.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You what?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yaaaawn! Snoooore! Snooooore!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's now how snoring works!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hell! Why does this happen to me! Aaaah!
Suddenly, I notice I'm half crying.
I take off the clothes covered in her vomit and wash them in the sink.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dammit... Fuck... I hate women. They're the worst...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: When Hachimaru's fixed, I'm gonna kick you out!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dammit all...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Zzz... *Snore* Zzz...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: *Sigh*
I'm still tired from yesterday.
My clothes still weren't dry when I woke up.
Azuki was sleeping away on the sofa like a baby.
Mental note: Never let Azuki drink again.
Or at the very least, not in the garage.
Today is day two.
This time my classmates didn't pay me much mind as I entered the classroom.
I sit by the window just like yesterday.
The bell rings at the same time as yesterday, and Sumomo comes into the room.
I watch her as she takes attendance.
There's something weird about her.
I don't get it.
It's like she's a different person here.
Seeing her like this, there's something definitively different.
I keep wondering why that is, and also why it's making me feel so anxious.
The last class on Tuesday morning turns out to be with Sumomo.
The subject is world history.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Um, because of all this, uh, unrest in Rome, they kind of realized that they might need, like, a kingly figure or a leader or something.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And then, since the people didn't want kings anymore, they made something called the republicanism.
Sumomo writes on the whiteboard as she dictates the lesson.

texts.name: Female Student
texts.text: Teacher.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes?!

texts.name: Female Student
texts.text: I think you misspelled that word.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?! Uh, really?!
She erases one letter of the word and replaces it with another.
I can't say I've seen that term before.

texts.name: Female Student
texts.text: Sorry, not that one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, th-this one?
She replaces another letter.
It still looks kind of wrong.

texts.name: Female Student
texts.text: Please look at the textbook.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: R-Right, sorry. I-I'm really sorry.
She flips through the textbook in a hurry.
An awkward silence sets in like a haze over the classroom.
The homeroom teacher is still sitting at the back of the room.
His loud sigh of disappointment can be heard in every corner of the silent classroom.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, like this...
So that's how you write republicanism.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Is that right?
Everyone in the class nods silently.
Her whole lesson pretty much went like that.
By the end, I felt like her own nervousness rubbed off on me, making me jittery and anxious.
Sumomo seemed happy that me coming back to class would help her get her license, but I wonder if it'll do her any good.
I'm not completely sure she'd be any good at this even if she did get her degree.
Perhaps because of Sumomo's lesson, at lunchtime I'm so exhausted I don't feel hungry at all.
I decide to kill some time on a rooftop bench.
Around me are gaggles of female students eating their lunch.
Most of the benches are packed.
On one of them sits a young man, surrounded by three girls.
The man is tall and his hair is cut short.
From what I overhear of the girl's talking, it seems like the man is also a college student doing his teacher training.
And a few benches to the side of them, I notice a familiar silhouette.
It's Sumomo, eating a pastry alone.
Is there such a gulf between fellow students?
It seems kind of cruel.
After staring at her for a while, she finally notices me.
She flashes me a smile and waves.
I give her a little nod in response.
Is she gonna come and sit with me?
But right as I think she's going to get up, Sumomo lowers her hand and turns back to her pastry.
What the hell?
Where did Sumomo go and what did that woman do to her?
There's something wrong here.
I get up and look out at Terminal 1 instead.
You can see the rubble from here.
I have two more classes this afternoon.
When I'm done with that, I'll go take pictures there again.
And so, after classes are over, I head to Terminal 1.
At the end of this road is a no entry zone, with nothing but ruins and trashed planes beyond.
That means no one comes here.
The garage has become a loud mess these last few days.
So getting some alone time is a godsend.
I take my camera out of its bag and hang it around my neck.
Slipping through the yellow and black tape, I head inside.
The deeper I go, the wider the space becomes.
Since the planes are so big, I figure you needed a lot of space back when there were lots of them.
I look at the scenery through my viewfinder.
I see an abandoned truck and a huge pole topped with busted lights.
Thick summer clouds roll by in the background.
I lose track of time taking pictures of the images reflected in my viewfinder, and before long, the sun starts setting.
Guess it's about time I head back home.
I look up at the scarlet sky.
I see the comet making its way through the scarlet expanse.
The comet is getting closer and closer to the destination of its 76 year trip.
I'll make it in time.
Azuki's repairing the car.
There aren't that many things you can photograph at night, and I'll be able to search for the place freely.
I'm so deep in my thoughts, I don't notice the footsteps coming closer until they're right behind me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?!
Who else would come here?!
That doesn't matter; being found by anyone here would mean trouble.
And I definitely don't need more of that.
I consider trying to hide in the shadow of the abandoned car, but as soon as I turn around, I find myself face to face with the source of the footsteps.
Ah...
Busted.
I wonder what this person's doing here.
They don't look like someone out on patrol.
She's wearing a white blouse with light pink detailing and has long white hair.
The tips of which are also tinged with pink.
And she's carrying a huge bag at her side.
Oh? What are you doing here?
Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?!
The woman smiles at me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's me, Sumomo!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wha?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You found me! Did you follow me here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hello? Earth to Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh... What? Sumomo?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why do you look so... different?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You don't like it?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Figures.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you doing here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Dressing up!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm being the best me!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Alone?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because people tell me to dye my hair black. And I'm tired of getting chewed out when I try to wear nice clothes.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I'm the kinda gal that starts stressing out when she can't shine, you know?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's why I sneak in here and transform!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Transform?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes. Into the me I love to be!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did I surprise you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's an understatement.
I'm damn surprised.
Because...
We're here for the same reason.
We're kind of doing the same thing.
I come here to take pictures so I don't have to tell anyone that I want to become a photographer.
And Sumomo comes here to look the way she wants to without anyone getting on her case about it.
Sumomo smiles at me.
It's a desolate, sad smile.
Sumomo's true white hair drifts in the wind, glowing with the evening sun as a backdrop.
Her face is slightly downturned, eyes closed.
I raise my camera and snap a shot.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah, sorry.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wait, what?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um, I just...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Y-Yes?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can I take some?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Photos.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: O-Of me?
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wh-Why?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Because I want to.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You look prettier than usual.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah... Heheh! Really?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. You look miles better now. I just want to take pictures of you.
I lift my camera again.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, er... What should I do?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Just act natural. Same as always.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: A-Act natural? W-Well, that's not too helpful.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay. Then tell me why you like this place so much.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Tell me about the kind of places you like.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: W-Well... It's so wide and open!
I take a picture of her spreading her arms wide.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And there's no one around!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yes, good.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And... it's quiet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, that's good. Your expression's loosening.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's that?! A shooting star?! It's not moving!
I lower the camera and look at her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You've gotta be kidding me...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna! Look at it! Do you see it?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's Halley's Comet. It's been there for the last three months.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No way! Really?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahah! Am I, like, super out of the loop?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It sure seems so.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahahah!
Laughing freely, she looks up at the sky again.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well that's not news to me!
The moment I snap that picture, I feel like my breathing stops.
Yes. This is it.
This is the Sumomo I wanted to see.
The Sumomo I wanted to capture.
I wanted to see her laughing like no one else can.
No matter what she looks like, this is something she can't hide.
It's a crime that someone with such a great smile is made to be sad.
This is what irks me so much when I see her in the classroom.
It's because I know.
I know just how beautiful Sumomo looks when she's happy and laughing.
I know.
Those are the thoughts racing through my mind as I press the shutter.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...You're beautiful. Really beautiful.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You have a really great smile.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, you're incredible.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't believe you can say something so corny with a straight face.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I think it's the first time someone has been that straightforward with me.
Her words make me blush a little.
My face feels hot now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You know...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe you do have talent! As a photographer, I mean.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You made me have lots of fun being photographed! For real!
Now I'm certain.
My blushing is so intense it's hard to hide even under the setting sun.
When night falls, we walk together down the abandoned road.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's with the hair?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's a wig.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Fake hair.
She pulls out a familiar swath of hair cut in the shape of a bowl from her bag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Heheheh, bet you couldn't tell. I'm super proud of my work.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You made It yourself?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah. It was a little more ruffled before, but I fixed it up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's an amazing skill.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Still...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Do you really need to do all this?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The whole teaching thing. You really wanna be a teacher?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah... Don't ask me that, dummy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sorry. I've been meaning to apologize to you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Me?
She nods.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: For what?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because you already decided what you wanna do with your life.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You wanna be a photographer, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If I didn't drag you to class, you'd have more time to actually do what you wanna do, instead of wasting it on other stuff.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I realized for real today. It's the first time I've seen you enjoying yourself like that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And I really feel like I'm super getting in the way of your dreams for my own sake.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I think it's amazing how you already know what your passion is while you're so young.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: People usually have no idea, so they just go to college in the meantime to kill some time.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But you're doing the teacher thing because you want to, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's the same thing. I don't think it'd be a bad thing to have a teacher like you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: As long as it's the real you. Like right now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Was the me from earlier today that bad?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think anyone could tell you that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, figures.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You should just be like you wanna be all the time. I think that's the best way to be.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I can't! I wouldn't be taken seriously.
For a while, only our footsteps echo along the lonely road back home.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I ran away from home, you know?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Back when I was 20.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: One day I ended up having to live with my mom. Money was tight and things got really tense between us. And I'm a huge idiot, so I ran away.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I took up jobs in hostess clubs to earn money, and I drank like a fish every single night.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I was surrounded by adult men and earning my own money. Back then I thought that I'd become a real adult.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mom found a new partner and was happy again. After a while, we reconnected and starting getting along pretty well.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh-huh.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: When I met her new husband for the first time and he asked about my job, I told him with my head held high, like it was the most normal thing ever. I thought it was a job like any other.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then he asked if I was some kind of whore, and started grilling my mom about whether she used to do that kind of thing as well. I don't think I've ever seen her drink a drop of alcohol in my life.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I got super frustrated, and Mom was crying about it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I thought he was a really huge douche, and that he was being mean for no reason. But then I went back to university and realized that there's lots of people who would look down on the kind of stuff I did. Hate me for it, even.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I see.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You probably feel the same way, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's fine. Just be honest.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well... I guess.
She smiles at me.
That same sad smile I saw back at Terminal 1.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's why I wanna take life seriously now!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's not like I'm living with my mom anymore. If I graduate and become a teacher, she'll be able to tell people about me with pride.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't think that's a reason to change yourself though.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think it's fine for you to stay the way you are.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If you prefer that job where you drink and entertain people, I think you should do it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, it's not like it was all sunshine and roses every day. I used to vomit every morning, and I got really fat from all the food.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It was just fun back then, feeling like I was really living it up.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But it wasn't like the fun you have taking photographs.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wonder now what is it that I really wanna do...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But since I haven't found it yet, I figure I might as well pick up teaching for my mom's sake.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: To prove that you're taking things seriously?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I just have a little more to go! I've never seen anything through to the end before, so that's something!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And that's why... Mmph!
Sumomo twists her hair up and somehow fits it all into a net, then puts on the wig.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'll just get through it, even if I have to be someone I don't like.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And that's that!
And with that, the conversation is over.
I keep thinking of her words as we continue walking.
And before long, I can't help but want to say something.
Until we reach a crossroads.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can I ask one thing?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Of course! I'm your teacher now!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If you died tomorrow, would you have any regrets?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hmm..

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Would you live the same day you did today if you knew you'd die tomorrow?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mmm...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Everyone keeps on living like they or the people around them are gonna be alive forever.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I know that's not the case.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mhm.
I turn my back to her and start walking.
After taking a few steps, I stop and turn back.
She's still looking at me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...See you tomorrow.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah! Tomorrow!
I take off the wig after seeing him off.
What if I die tomorrow?
Does he even need to ask?
This isn't what I wanna do.
It'll never work out for me, not in a million years.
I know both the teachers and students see me as a huge fraud.
But everyone's smarter than me.
They can keep it together.
There's not much else I can do, is there?
I twirl the wig in my hands.
But...
Someday...
I really wish I could talk with Kanna all the time as my real self. Not pretending to be something I'm not.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey there, Candy. Pretty late today, eh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Where's Bitch?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Call her Peach, would you?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Never mind.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: She ain't coming today?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't think so.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Bummer.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: By the by. I know it's a little late to ask, but...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What're you gonna do when the car's fixed?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I mean, you can't drive.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can. I just don't have a license.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hahah! Planning on driving without a license, are you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Man, that brings back memories. I used to do that all the time.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I drove all over those country roads with no license. Boy, those were the days.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whoa, really?
Seemingly deep in her memory land, Azuki fails to acknowledge my question.
It actually really scares me even thinking of committing such a huge crime, but getting to know a pioneer in that department reassures me a little.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The recklessness of youth and candy sweet ideas. You're not half bad.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Where do you wanna go? Just travel around?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's what I'm trying to find out.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Haah...
I should've gone and grabbed some stuff this morning.
No, way before that.
But I was too preoccupied with the car.
Now I can finally do what I gotta do.
Even if I wait until my dad's gone tomorrow morning, the result will be pretty much the same.
But...
I better put my money where my mouth is and do justice to the stuff I told Sumomo earlier.
Don't leave for tomorrow what you can do today.
The lights of the living room are on.
My dad must be in there.
After taking a deep breath, I enter the house.
Sure enough, my dad is in the living room, reading a book.
He looks up when I move into the entrance.
I see his gaze travel up to my forehead for a moment.
He must have noticed the haircut.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hm? What is it?
Dad asks, turning his attention back to his book.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wanna borrow one of the old albums.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Photo albums?
He raises his head again.
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Where are they?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Which ones do you need?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The ones from when we camped together.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: That's pretty much all of them.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Wait right there.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Here.
Dad goes up to the second floor then comes back with a bag containing about a dozen or so bundles of albums.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.
After handing me the bag, Dad goes back to the sofa and picks up his book again.
Is this okay?
I hesitate for a moment, then turn and walk toward the front door.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Kanna.
He calls out to me, and I turn back.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Are you going to class?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I'm gonna focus on photography this summer. I... don't know if I'll go on to a specialized course.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll attend until the end of the semester.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Good night.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Isn't it hot out in the garage?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. It has good ventilation, though, so it's okay.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: All right.
I walk back to the garage, starting to feel the weight of the albums in both of my arms.
Was it okay to leave the conversation at that?
Was there more I should have said?
Maybe Dad is thinking the same.
He gave me the albums without asking questions.
I really want him to understand.
I want him to know that I'm serious about becoming a photographer.
And if possible, I'd like his support.
This is a new feeling I've never really had before.
Maybe I wouldn't have felt if if I'd just kept being stubborn and not gone to class.
Today was the first time ever where I didn't clam up when trying to talk to Dad.
Maybe...
I could graduate, give up on further study, and say I want to study photography while working.
That would be a compromise...
One I feel like we could both come to terms with now.
But that only means...
This summer is really important.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mm... What's that?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Nothing. It's like my homework.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Gotcha. You sure got your work cut out for you too, eh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I sure do.
I unpin Mom's sketch from the cork board next to the sink and take it with me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can I go into the car for a while?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Sure thing.
I place Mom's sketch on the camper's desk.
Maybe the place is at one of the campsites we visited as a family.
It could be one of the many locations she scouted together with us.
One of them must be the place Mom chose to photograph the comet.
I take the albums out of the bag and pile them up on top of the desk.
I also ready a notepad and a pen.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay...
First, I need to list out all the places we went.
Then I've got to rule out all the locations that obviously wouldn't work.
After that, I can keep ruling out potential sites one by one by checking regional books at the library.
I'm sure I can find it this way.
Mom's cheeky grin comes to mind.
It must be one of the places I went to with her.
Otherwise, she wouldn't have bothered hiding it from me.
I psych myself up, open the first album, and start looking through our camping pictures.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Amei.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Present.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Inoue.
It's day three.
Sumomo came to class again in her usual smart getup.
I find myself staring at her.
She definitely looks better when she smiles.
I'm sure she'd be way more popular if she acted like herself.
With both the boys and the girls, for sure.
Actually, maybe not the girls?
But at least she wouldn't be surrounded on all sides by people that either looked at her with disdain or actively disliked her.
The thing I really can't figure out, though...
Is why I'm so frustrated about this.
I know the usual noisy and crass Sumomo.
It's not that I particularly like her being that way, but I'm sure it's what fits her the best.
And it's the way that makes me want to snap pictures of her.
Why doesn't anyone else seem to realize?
This woman is clearly not living her best life.
Why does no one notice?
It's like no one really cares about the people around them.
What's the point of us all gathering here and being together, then?
It's so weird.
No. I guess I'm the weird one for thinking this way.
Not like it matters.
Yesterday we had classes all day, but today we finish after morning lessons.
I kind of remember classes ending early on the days leading up to summer break last year.
I'm already back home by noon.
It's perfect.
If I can finish pinpointing the possible campsites before the semester ends, I'll be able to hit the library and do my research as soon as summer break starts.
I'll finish up either today tomorrow, or the day after that at the latest.
I can feel things looking up a little now.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Nhah... Oh, Candy? It's morning? *Yawn*

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Noon, actually.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, that so? *Yawn*
Azuki yawns and stretches out, which causes interesting things to happen to her voluptuous curves.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How many times do I need to tell you to wear clothes?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, sorry ‘bout that. Slipped my mind.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you working on today? Can I be in the car?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm? Sure. You gonna be up to something in there again?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go right ahead. The part we need ain't here yet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can help you with the repairs if you want.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Nah. There's not much I can do till the starter arrives.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm kinda curious about something you said before. You know, the whole thing about what to do if it doesn't work even with the new starter.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Uh-huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So if that happens, what do we do?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it, as they say.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Pray, Candy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm not a fan of that saying.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We'll figure something out! 'Sides, there's more Hachimarus out there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No!
Azuki's clearly surprised by my fervent rebuttal.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It has to be this car.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Then you better get praying, my sweet boy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's Lake Kawaguchi...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hahah, that's where Mom fell out of the canoe.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It was winter, and she was shivering all day after that.
I remember Mom laughing her ass off while dripping with water.
I remember it well.
I took this picture.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We had so much fun there...
I write down Lake Kawaguchi as a possible location as I reminiscence about our time there.
Looking back on things, we really visited a lot of places together.
There are also pictures from when we went to see the first sunrise of the new year at Omaezaki beach.
And pictures of us on the observation deck at Cape Shioya.
I think we camped nearby and explored the area by car.
Most of the photos in the albums are of me, taken by Mom.
If I knew what would happen...
If only I knew she'd be gone so soon, I would have picked up a camera earlier and taken even more pictures of her.
I feel the tears coming.
Shaking my head to drive them away, I reach out for the next album.
When I've been through more albums than I have left to look at, I step back out into the garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah! Howdy!
Sumomo's here.
She's still in her work clothes.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Where's Azuki?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Smoking outside. You got her to stop doing it inside?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's lots of stuff that can catch fire in here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! We've had enough fire to last us a lifetime, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'd rather she not burn us to a crisp.
I walk past Sumomo and go to the sink.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So you were in the car, huh? I didn't realize.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeppers.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh, are you angry?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why do you say that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You seem kinda grumpy. What's up? Shouldn't I have come in without permission?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's a bit late for that now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahah! Good point.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why are you dressed like that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't need to be in work mode when you're here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I do! Otherwise I'm gonna get carried away.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You just happened to find me like that yesterday.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If I don't dress like this, I'll forget we're supposed to be teacher and student.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm dumb, you know.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Who cares? Just do you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're here to hang out, not to teach me anything.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nooo, I can't!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But thanks.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't you hate it though?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're way prettier when you dress up the way you like.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm sure all your students think you're some kind of country bumpkin.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah. So I'm not a peach anymore, huh? Sumomo Bumpkin is is, then!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't you hate that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Not at all?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why not?!
Even I'm surprised by my raised tone.
But Sumomo seems not to care as she puts a finger to her lips and thinks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mmh... Guess I got used to it? I guess I kinda just don't care what people say about me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, I don't really care about the opinion of anyone in that class.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's not really the part I hate about dressing like this.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You know how people like your mom and our Scrap Hunter live freely, dressing how they like and doing whatever they want?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I guess?
Azuki certainly doesn't care when I tell her to put on clothes.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What I hate is wanting to live like that and not being able to right now. Hmm. It's like I'm feeling kinda lonely where I am?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Me feeling unhappy doesn't have to do much with what others say or think about me. I'm kind of self-sufficient like that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're weird.
She smiles upon hearing that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've had a weird life.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, Peach! You didn't bring anything tasty today?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I brought cup noodles, actually.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Where's the booze, woman?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're a terrible drunk.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Me?! No way.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hmm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't remember?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's there to remember?
Azuki stops and looks at me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wha?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It happens, yep.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You pushed me down onto the sofa and vomited all over me!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It happens, yep.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Me? Don't be silly.
Azuki shakes her head and returns to her work.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I've never been drunk.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You gotta be kidding me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's what they always say. It happens, oh it does.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What're you doing here anyway, Peach?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I kind of finished work already, so I don't have much to do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now that I don't have to prepare lessons anymore, I feel like a ton got lifted off my shoulders.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What do you even teach?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: World History.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hahah! You?! Get outta here!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Azuki, know what republicanism is?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Republicanism. Think you can spell it?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No way in hell, dude.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahah! I knew it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You staying, Sumomo? I'll go back to the car.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? In there? But why? What're you doing in there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's something I gotta do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What is it? I wanna see!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Peach.
Azuki turns to Sumomo and shakes her head.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Do you need to ask? We're dealing with a guy here. He's going to spank the monkey.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, right. He's gonna make the baldie cry, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No! I don't do that in there!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, whatever you say. That's our good boy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You think I've been, err, doing you-know-what in there since last night?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah. What else is there to do in there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Tons of stuff!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Come on, don't hold out on us! What're you doing?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: He's greasing the pipe, that's what he's doing!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No I'm not! And it's a secret!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! What a cutie!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Shut up!
I go into the camper and close the door.
I can still hear them joking around.
With one ear on their boisterous chatter, I open the next album and continue listing out campsites.
After a while, the voices outside Hachimaru cease.
Maybe Sumomo went home.
I get up and stretch.
I'm making good progress.
But I'm already yawning and my eyes are getting teary.
Rubbing them to stay awake, I turn to the next page.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah...
I find another photo of Mom smiling.
And Dad's next to her.
Which means...
...I took this photo too.
She looks really happy.
It reminds of Sumomo's smile from yesterday.
Mom and Azuki.
Sumomo said they dressed and lived how they wanted.
What I hate is wanting to live like that and not being able to...
Her words come back to me, then disappear.
I look to my side.
Mom's printer is still there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oof!
I lift up the printer in both arms.
It's heavy, so heavy I can barely carry it on my own.
Using my foot, I open the back door.
Then stick my head out.
Azuki's already asleep on the sofa.
Moving carefully, I get out of the car and connect the printer to an outlet.
When I press the on button, a green light comes up, and I hear some internal part of the machine whirr into life.
I insert my camera's memory stick directly into the printer.
Yesterday's photos come up on the little LCD display.
Pressing the button, I move through the slideshow.
I choose the photo and press print.
A loud noise comes from the printer.
For a moment, I worry about waking Azuki, but then I realize that the sound of her snoring is equally loud.
It's unlikely that anything could wake that woman.
Sumomo's smile is very much like my mom's.
I truly think so.
I feel like it perfectly encapsulates what Sumomo meant when she talked about being who she wanted to be.
I really like this picture.
I'm sure Sumomo will like it too.
Of that, I'm confident.
I'll give this photo to her tomorrow.
I look over my shoulder at the sofa.
Azuki's now snoring at full force.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I told her to turn off the lights before going to bed.
I switch off the garage lights then climb back up into Hachimaru, taking the printer with me.
